intro: Tetrataenium bivittatum, commonly known as the two-striped tetrataenium, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or calcareous soils. The plant features slender, hairy stems and pinnately compound leaves with a distinctive two-colored pattern. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, typical of the carrot family. Tetrataenium bivittatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
